page.title: 01Part of East and West Knoyle
page.content: This area is mainly on Blackmore vale where the main agriculture is managed grassland for dairy and beef cattle. The soil is a heavy clay and generally unsuitable for ploughing. The land rises to the north and east to a greensand ridge. Most of the unmanaged woodland is in this area which is too steep to plough. Some people live and work on the farms but the majority of the residents are retired people living in old cottages. Most of the people have moved in from other parts of the country. Some of the woodland is common land and is inhabited by badger, foxes and roe deer as well as a wide variety of birds.
